result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric Oneal McGee Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric Oneal McGee Jr in court.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court for Eric Oneal McGee Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Louk in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and request Jury Trial and Final Pretrial dates be set. Court sets 10/11/2022 deadline for State to turnover any additional discovery.  Crime Lab reports shall be turned over prior to the Final Pretrial date.  Case adjourned to Br. 9. Final pre-trial scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 10:00 am. Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric Oneal McGee in court with Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer H. Sosa. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 09.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES: 
  Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.
 Defendant Eric Oneal McGee in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Eric Oneal McGee in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
